description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9l9i1","text":"Accurate and absolute determination of AAV transduction from total DNA is important for understanding gene transfer efficiency across multiple experimental manipulations. As compared to relative measurements (e.g. through comparison of qPCR CT values between experimental conditions), absolute quantification can provide biological insights (e.g. actual average MOIs) that can guide further development of these vectors. This protocol enables absolute measurement of AAV genome number from total DNA samples extracted from animal tissues. Because total DNA is extracted, it is possible to estimate the number of AAV genomes per cell, using DNA content per cell and an estimate of transduction efficiency. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6biq9","text":"Before beginning, ensure that you are able to specifically detect your AAV genome and design PCR reactions. We recommend using probe-based assays and designing 2 separate assays against distinct sequences in your target genome, with 2 separate fluorophores to detect each target sequence separately. During analysis, only count spots positive for both target sequences as true positives.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":347,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jh88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rflq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqive","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"33usc","text":"This protocol is for quantifying absolute AAV genome count from total DNA, and thus can be used to estimate average MOI by incorporating per cell DNA content and transduction rate. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7tcck","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e23vs","text":"Because total DNA is used, amplification of off-target sequences in host genome can increase the false positive rate. This protocol mitigates this by amplifying 2 separate target sequences, readout by spectrally distinct probes. Only droplets positive for both target sequences are considered as true positives. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7pblr","text":"Process samples with Qiagen DNeasy Blood and Tissue total DNA purification kit. Follow manufacturer instructions for total DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h4bk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47h8d","text":"Measure [DNA] using a spectrophotometer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ot8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o5n5","text":"If processing immediately, total DNA samples can be kept on ice or at    until ready to proceed. Alternatively, store at   or   until ready to proceed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":121,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":126,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9lkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-70","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak15a","text":"Begin tissue collection.  Euthanize animals according to your lab's approved protocol, then transcardially perfuse animals with    of heparinized PBS. Working quickly, dissect out and place tissue of interest into a petri dish with ice-cold PBS, then isolate regions of interest. Dissect tissues of interest into 2-3 mm cubes (maximum   of wet tissue weight), and transfer to 1.5 mL tubes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":128,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":335,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6vmj6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43eq4","text":"If processing immediately, keep tissue on ice until ready to process (Step 6).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lgth","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4vtt","text":"If not processing immediately, snap-freeze tissue by immersing tubes in the dry ice-ethanol slurry, and store on dry ice until ready to transfer to   . Once ready to begin processing, remove from   and proceed to step 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":148,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":196,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9htg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8keu8","text":"If also collecting tissue to fix, gently drop tissue into 4% PFA in 1x PBS, and post-fix at     , then proceed with standard procedures. Fresh tissue may also be harvested and homogenized, dissociated or snap-frozen for other downstream analyses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":92,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":94,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-70","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-70","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22bsv","text":"On day of harvest, prepare work area. You will need: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h5n9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csv78","text":"ice-cold 1x PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qf8k","text":"ice-cold 1x heparinized PBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a90kt","text":"clean 10 cm petri dishes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bsbgs","text":"ice ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkqkn","text":"tools for perfusion and microdissection","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7eaov","text":"1.5 mL tubes for tissue collection","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gje1","text":"dry ice (optional; if choosing to snap freeze tissue, rather than processing immediately)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j4qg","text":"dry ice-ethanol slurry (optional; if choosing to snap freeze tissue, rather than processing immediately)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vpan","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"527u8","text":"Pre-label collection tubes. If planning to freeze tissue, use an ethanol-resistant marker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b84","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3t2a","text":"If analysis of fixed tissue is also desired (e.g. for detection of an AAV-encoded fluorescent protein), prepare tubes with appropriate volumes of 4% PFA in 1x PBS and keep on ice. In addition, tissue may be collected and homogenized, dissociated, or snap-frozen for other downstream analyses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nhf9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q0vn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3e33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"18iaf","text":"Collection time is dependent upon experimental question. This protocol detects the AAV's DNA genome, so does not rely on reporter gene expression. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ji18","text":"Transduce animals with AAVs, carrying sequence that will be amplified in droplet PCR reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20tgq","text":"General note on sample preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35kbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhl8q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cqemv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9dirq","text":"This protocol should work with either fixed or fresh tissues. However, because DNA recovered from fixed tissue will be more fragmented, for best results we recommend processing fresh tissue. Thus, if fixed samples are also required for parallel analyses, it may be best to post-fix only. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"124bv","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7c6sr","text":"E.g. for analysis of transduction in brain by both ddPCR and by fluorescence microscopy, post-fix one hemisphere overnight in 4% PFA, 1x PBS, and microdissect the other hemisphere fresh for ddPCR. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tkjl","text":"Note about restriction enzyme digest","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e56dh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pn7h","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a6omq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bn8ug","text":"ddPCR detects molecules that contain 1 or more copies of each target sequence. Because, AAV genomes concatemerize in host cells (one AAV molecule containing multiple genome copies), it is necessary to digest AAV concatemers into constituent genomes so that they can be partitioned into separate droplets and accurately quantified. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"di0rd","text":"Choose restriction enzymes that cut AAV genome in or near ITR regions, and that do not cut within target amplicons. Ideally, choose enzymes that:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3leuc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fsfp","text":"can be used in a single reaction","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64d7q","text":"can be safely used in   digests","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1kk3","text":"can be heat inactivated ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es10f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"546av","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e69s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8q1jf","text":"We have used (a) single digests with SmaI, which digests within the AAV2 ITR, and (b) double digests with KpnI-HF and SpeI-HF, which cut beside the AAV2 ITR in our vector genomes. When used on the same samples, both of these digest paradigms produced comparable results. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Use manufacturer-suggested incubation temperature (e.g.   ), and heat-inactivate, if possible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":102,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"89h5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nnav","text":"To ensure complete digestion, we recommend digesting samples   (if allowable by chosen restriction enzymes). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ul5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fdn2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"frhs9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e55df","text":"Given the multitude of parameters that can be optimized (restriction enzyme choice(s), enzyme concentrations, incubation times, etc.), we recommend initially testing two separate restriction enzyme choices in overnight reactions, and comparing results. {"blocks":[{"key":"bbhtj","text":"Note about optimal dilution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqjfr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aho47","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"83oba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":4,"offset":301,"style":"italic"}],"key":"9cmsf","text":"CRITICAL It is important to dilute samples so that the target molecules are within the dynamic range of ddPCR. The optimal dilution will be dependent on multiple factors (viral dose, tissue, etc.) and may need to be determined empirically. We recommend either (a) running a 10-fold serial dilution on all samples, starting from a 1:10 dilution or (b) optimizing dilution on a single sample and then repeating with all samples at optimal dilution. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ctq8i","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":170,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1att5","text":"For measuring AAV transduction of cortex and liver by AAV-PHP.eB, injected retro-orbitally into C57BL/6J male mice at 3e11 vg, we found that a 1/10 dilution of a 50 ng/µL digested total DNA prep was optimal. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5v92","text":"Make a plan for digital droplet PCR. We recommend running at least 2 technical replicates per sample, and multiplexing 2 separate target sequences in the same wells, using different fluorophores. Prepare extra to account for pipetting error. title: Absolute quantification of AAV genomes from total DNA with digital droplet PCR (ddPCR)
title_html: Absolute quantification of AAV genomes from total DNA with digital droplet PCR (ddPCR)

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"gg00","text":"AAVs are biohazardous materials and must be handled according to governmental and institutional regulations. Experiments involving AAVs were performed using biosafety level 2 practices as required by the California Institute of Technology and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.\n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74jf5","text":"rAAVs, although replication-incompetent, are potent gene-delivery vehicles and must be handled according to governmental and institutional regulations. The safety of packaged transgenes (e.g., oncogenic genes) should be carefully considered. Perform all procedures in a certified biosafety cabinet and clean AAV-contaminated equipment, surfaces, and labware with fresh 10% (vol/vol) bleach.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
